title.narrative: Improved child protection and psychosocial support service provision for children affected by the conflict in Area C

description.narrative: This project targets children directly and indirectly exposed to violence and abuse by the Israeli Occupation. War Child and the project partners will be targeting the most marginalized communities of the Jordan Valley-Area C (Zbeidat, Fasayil Fouqa, Fasayil Wusta, An Nweima al-Fouqa, Al Jiftlik-Al Ajaj, Al Hadidya, Ein Al Beida, Kardala, Al Farisya, Humsa, Wadi Al Maleh and Bardala). Evictions, demolitions, and UXO are constant risks for Palestinian children living in those communities of the Jordan Valley that Israel has declared as "firing zones". In addition to that there are some components in the project specifically for child detainees and ex-detainees in EJ and Qalqylia which have the highest rate of child arrest and detention. The project will focus on activities that meet the growing identified and perceived needs of children mainly focusing on increased access to child protection response and prevention services as well as strengthening child protection mechanisms through service provision, capacity building and coaching of community members, social workers and caregivers. Outputs are designed to meet strategic objectives 2 of the HRP 2018-2020: providing support to meet the basic needs of the vulnerable population, particularly children. Each organization in this consortium provides expertise at different levels of an integrated holistic prevention and accountability system and care response – War Child is coordinator of, and accountable for the project with high level technical support in the case management system. Under this project DCIP will be focusing on the communities under Tubas Governorate in the Northern Jordan Valley and will provide awareness sessions on child rights and child protection principles, forming child-led protection teams, conducting initiatives led by the children focusing on children issues and priorities, psychosocial support services for children at risk of violence and abuse in the targeted communities as well as monitoring, documentation and reporting of child rights violations in all the West Bank. PCC provides child group support for ex-detainee children and support groups for caregivers of children detainees and ex-detainees in EJ and Qalqilya which are considered with the highest number of arrest and detention. In the Jordan Valley/Area C communities, PCC will focus on the communities under the Jericho Governorate through engaging and activating existing CBOs in the targeted communities, recruitment and capacity building for emergency response teams who will be trained on PCC Psychological First Aid (PFA) and how to respond when an emergency incident occurs. Several organizations in the West Bank, including East Jerusalem, partially respond to the needs of children in the Jordan Valley. However, the coverage of services is fragmented and there is a recognized gap in the provision of holistic and coordinated services.
